website_summaries.verdict: A versatile digital wrench known for its quality construction and precision.
cons: Fewer features than its digital competitor (Brown Line Metalworks)

customer_reviews.title: Ohh, YES ***It does work at 4 ft/Ibs  read.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and Yes starts at lowest point at 3.8 ft/Ibs. Before starting first set your measurement scale. Turn off the unit. Press power, and hold display will show 0.0 ft/Ib. Starts torquing right before 3.7 display would show the ft/Ibs. At this point you may look at the display to set the torque for any range less than 10. You will not have access to buzzer or setting. The alarm and buzzer setting only would work and apply for greater 10 ft/Ibs . Pictures to proof it.
customer_reviews.author: Armen Martin

customer_reviews.title: Beeps After the desired setting. Useless garbage
customer_reviews.text: Manual states that it starts to beep at 90% of set torque settings and beeps intensely at desired setting. However, I tested at multiple settings and it starts to beep at about 5 ft-lbs AFTER the desired setting and beeps intensely at around 8-10 ft-lbs AFTER. This is completely useless as a torque wrench. Do not bother buying.
customer_reviews.author: 1FSTTOY

customer_reviews.title: Great product, needs some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: I love this wrench, it's got plenty of features but it could also be improved. I first struggled to get the battery door off, turns out you have to slightly lift and then slide it out. Figuring out the controls to get it into in-lbs or Ft-lbs was a challenge. I wish the manual was a bit clearer but I did figure it all out with that assistance. Things that could be changed: Backlit screen and larger readout Longer auto-off time period or ability to disable Different tones for close and "at" torque spec. Improved interface.
customer_reviews.author: David Stroz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - alarm doesnt work at your setting
customer_reviews.text: As other people said, i set the alarm to 50 ft-lb but the tool starts beeping at (55ft-lb)5 ft-lb OVER The setting, and beep steady at (60ft-lb) 10ft-lb OVER Same if you set it at 10 it will beep steady at 20 ft-lb. My first test was at 10ft-lb and second at 50ft-lb
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without instructions or batteries even though product description states they are included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does its job very well
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it's very difficult to hit exactly 5.0Nm. As another reviewer mentioned, you can't set the bell that low, and it jumps straight from 0.0 to 5.0. Can be done (I've got several 5 Nm screws on my bike), but it's a pain. Other than that minor issue, this is a fantastic tool.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clemmer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the money. Only compliant is that you can continue torquing past what you designated it to be. It is a good and bad thing. When you reach the amount of torque you put in, machine makes an audible buzzing noise. I used this on an e46, made the job a thousand times easier.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Seriously!!!  No batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Do I need to say more? I just opened my torq wrench and attempted to use it and found out that it doesn't even come with batteries.
customer_reviews.author: T. Freed

customer_reviews.title: Snap in batteries and go
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny, just make sure you have the right adapter for any sockets you’re using with it. Needs 4 AAA batteries not included
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works, but I recommend a click type.
customer_reviews.text: Works, but I recommend a click type. In the bright sun the LCD screen can be challenging to see (not the fault of the device) and the click type don't need batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Attorney

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I used this to torque my wheel lugnuts works okay. I would check back again to re torque using this.
customer_reviews.author: A.I.

customer_reviews.title: Great Torque wrench
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised ... I've been putting off buying a torque wrench for years but buying a Porsche project car finally made me pull the trigger. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine - we'll see how it holds up
customer_reviews.text: Torque wrench feels well built, and digital operation is a breeze. My only complaint so far is that although the display reads as low as 5 nm, you cannot set the alarm any lower than 13.5nm. This is a very minor issue, but something to be aware of. When tightening to low torques, you just have to watch the display. The display can be set to show peak torque, so it really isn't a problem, just something I would've liked to have known before I ordered it. After I abuse the wrench a little more, I will try to report back on how it is surviving.
customer_reviews.author: Yossarian

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: If this had a vibrate function to indicate as well as the light and noise it would be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use it while doing services on a motorcycle. You can't set the alarm below 13 N/M but you can still use the peak or trace function to verify that you met the torque requirements that are below 13 N/M.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: A precision professional torque wrench. Very sturdy construction. It does the job effortlessly. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate measurement
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically because the range of 4 to 99 foot pounds was great for my tool collection, but it starts at 10 foot pounds not 4 like what they say. So the project I bought it for is put on hold until I can get a wrench that can get me 7.2 foot pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Brady F.

customer_reviews.title: Digital Torque Wrench
customer_reviews.text: As a DIY, everyone should have this unique special tool in their tool box/ area! A MUST HAVE....
customer_reviews.author: Russell, CM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Saves last setting and has ~100 memory positions, also has auto off and looks very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Vic S.

customer_reviews.title: Already showing "Err" when turning on and it has never been torque past it limits
customer_reviews.text: Only 14 months old and it already is displaying "Err" when turning on. This torque wrench has never been received any mistreatment and never been stressed past it designed and documented limits. Very disappointing indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Tessilu

customer_reviews.title: Easier to tighten bolt
customer_reviews.text: Very handy on tightening your bolts on your vehicles correctly
customer_reviews.author: Chianti Reese

customer_reviews.title: Digital torque wrench
customer_reviews.text: I love this torque wrench. Other than having to check the display for the lower torque specs, this product works well.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: I just hot but it foes not work...it does not power on...i thougt it need battery but not...not working
customer_reviews.author: Valentina Zalazar

customer_reviews.title: I believe its a very good piece.
customer_reviews.text: First time owning a torque wrench, I believe its a very good piece.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Perez

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't work!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work. Followed the instructions. The first time I went to use it I got an Error code "Err" on the display.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Jessep

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat it. Used it to put on a set of beadlocks. It is not a Snap On, not as user friendly as the Snap On, but gets the job done if you are looking for a lower toque zone wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Premer

customer_reviews.title: great product, very strong also
customer_reviews.text: its a great tool very precise, its a shame the screen does not have any light
customer_reviews.author: Lester Solano Quesada

customer_reviews.title: nice wrench
customer_reviews.text: nice product at the right price. There are certainly more expensive wrenches available, but I only pull this out a couple times a year when changing summer to winter tires.
customer_reviews.author: let's play two.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great wrench it has been working great for our engine rebuild
customer_reviews.author: Brian Albright

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. If you rebuild motors or motorcycles this is the tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality and digital
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a digital unit and the acdelco brand is good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Beament

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tool for Scooter Work.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the 3/8 (2 - 37 ft-lbs) and the 1/2 (3 - 99 ft-lbs) to do work on my Piaggio / Vespa Scooters. Having these tools are important to Torque these Scooters to the manufacturers values when do maintenance. It is very easy to brake bolts, and the repair of removing pop bolts can be very expensive. The battery life is very good, and the automatic shut off is very nice. I use it in Nm mode, and depending on what I am doing, it is very easy to use the Up/Down arrow to set the value.
customer_reviews.author: Keith LaBorde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great purchase. Very easy to set torque and buzzer rings, then gives you actual torque reading. Uses traditional batteries as opposed to coin batteries, too. A must-have in your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: VaRedSoxFan

customer_reviews.title: Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for someone and they loved it. They said it was very well made and worked well for them.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: nice item seems to work as described have only needed ...
customer_reviews.text: nice item seems to work as described have only needed to use twice so far but it's easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Fstopf4

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and he is very impressed
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: if it had that it would be perfect, but works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Needs a backlit display, if it had that it would be perfect, but works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: kristen D

customer_reviews.title: Not much torque for a 1/2in wrench
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish looks good but that 99ftlbs max for a 1/2 in wrench seems light ...... I'm returning mine
customer_reviews.author: Leddie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't needed it yet but it is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: t2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A Good and economic tool for my work on the Airfield. Carl, Aruba
customer_reviews.author: Carl Tjong-A-Tjoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great every time also beeps when torque limit reached
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Precise tool for critical applications
customer_reviews.text: I used this wrench to tighten the bolt holding my steering wheel in place. It made a night and day difference once tightened per spec. Couldn't have done it without this wrench. The torque adjustments are easy to make and the peak and trace options work perfectly. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: D@rkFX

customer_reviews.title: Dont read reviews. jut buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. did a great job on my motorcycle center stand. abig difference between clicker wrench and digital. but i am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulrasoul Almansour

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench is a very good tool. It's relatively easy to dial-in a torque value, and you'll get an audible sound when your torque value is reached. I use this torque wrench to tighten the bolts for my alloy wheels. In this position though, it's extremely difficult to read the small display when applying torque to the wrench. However, I do like this wrench much more than a standard clicker type.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the audible alarm, so you can watch what you are doing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Indicate below 10 Ft-lbs, not 4 as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It is false advertising, it can't be set to alarm below 10 ft-lbs. If you buy this, as I did to mostly torque bolts in the low range (for motorcycles) it is a waste of money. I purchased from New Zealand, and spent $20 on shipping but it would cost me far more than that to return it by courier. So I might as well keep it as it is uneconomic for me to return. I have wanted a digital torque wrench for a long time and and I specifically bought this one as it advertised the whole range of torque settings I needed. It is very disappointing and there is no way I'd buy another tool from them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr K Estcourt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. I only used it to torque my wheel screws an is being perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota Man

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: takes the guess work out of setting the torque value
customer_reviews.author: Everett D. Carey

customer_reviews.title: I wish we never wasted our money on this product and would never buy ...
customer_reviews.text: We just got this to fix my husband’s truck. The box says it Can be set from 4 to 99 ft pounds. This is not true they lied it will only go as low as 10. I wish we never wasted our money on this product and would never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Torque Wrench starts peeping approx 5 nm before you reach ...
customer_reviews.text: Torque Wrench starts peeping approx 5 nm before you reach the NM you have set, but you still over torque because is does not stop nor does that wrench give you any other kind of sign that you hit the set NM. I prefer those ones with the "click" you can hear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are very good quality products and satisfy my needs
customer_reviews.text: They are very good quality products and satisfy my needs, I always arrive on time and there has never been any problem so buy on amazon. by security and guarantee. What I do not like the torque wrench is ranging from 4 ft-lb to 99ft-lb is not really going 10 ft-lb to 99 ft-lb buy the thought that was 4 ft-lb but that is a deception.
customer_reviews.author: maria bernal

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wrench because it had all three measurements fb,ip,nm, it works ok, the auto shut off dosent work well killed the batteries first time I used it,the display isn't very good either,i thought with the ac delco name it would be a good wrench,i wouldn't buy this brand again. I do not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

product_meta.title: ACDelco ARM601-4 1/2" Digital Torque Wrench with Buzzer (9.9 to 99 ft-lbs.), with Vibration & Flash Notification - ISO 6789 Standards with Certificate of Calibration
product_meta.description: The torque wrench is probably one of the most used specialty tools when it comes to automotive work. The ACDelco ARM601-4 Digital Torque Wrench is designed to provide a more precise torque with various mode settings. This torque wrench has a built-in audible buzzer and LCD display to show your measurement (ft.-lb., Nm, in-lb., kg-cm) settings. Easily power this tool with two (2) AAA batteries, making it very lightweight and durable. Ranging from 9.9-99 ft.-lbs., this digital torque wrench is definitely a must-have for cars.
feature_bullets: [Advanced Technology]: 9.9 to 99 foot pounds torque range with LED flashing / vibration / buzzer alarm when torque is reached. Easy to read LCD display with measurements (kg-cm, N-m, in-lb. ft-lb)
[Multiple Setting Functions]: Torque, Measurement, and, Peak & Trace, Mode Settings. (Torque setting range: 10% of max torque value. Measuring range: 4 to 99 ft-lbs. )
[High Accuracy]: 2% clockwise 3% CCW of indicated value, CW, from 20% to 100% of full scale.
[Quality Assurance]: Meets or exceeds ASME B107. 14-2004, ISO 6789 standards, individually serialized with matching certificate of calibration traceable to N. I. S. T.
Uses 2x AAA Batteries. One-year limited manufacturer warranty
